verses.kjv: And he said unto Moses, Come up unto the LORD, thou, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel; and worship ye afar off.
verses.web: He said to Moses, “Come up to LORD, you, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel; and worship from a distance.
verses.ct: God said to Moses, "Come up to the LORD — you, Aaron, Nadab, Abihu, and 70 of Israel's elders. But stay at a distance and worship from there."

verses.kjv: And Moses alone shall come near the LORD: but they shall not come nigh; neither shall the people go up with him.
verses.web: Moses alone shall come near to LORD, but they shall not come near. The people shall not go up with him.”
verses.ct: "Only Moses may approach the LORD directly. The others must not come close, and the rest of the people must not come up the mountain at all."

verses.kjv: And Moses came and told the people all the words of the LORD, and all the judgments: and all the people answered with one voice, and said, All the words which the LORD hath said will we do.
verses.web: Moses came and told the people all LORD’s words, and all the ordinances; and all the people answered with one voice, and said, “All the words which LORD has spoken will we do.”
verses.ct: Moses went back and told the people everything the LORD had said, including all of his laws. The people answered together with one voice: "We will do everything the LORD has told us."

verses.kjv: And Moses wrote all the words of the LORD, and rose up early in the morning, and builded an altar under the hill, and twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.web: Moses wrote all LORD’s words, then rose up early in the morning and built an altar at the base of the mountain, with twelve pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.ct: Moses wrote down everything the LORD had said. Early the next morning, he built an altar at the base of the mountain and set up 12 stone pillars — one for each of the 12 tribes of Israel.

verses.kjv: And he sent young men of the children of Israel, which offered burnt offerings, and sacrificed peace offerings of oxen unto the LORD.
verses.web: He sent young men of the children of Israel, who offered burnt offerings and sacrificed peace offerings of cattle to LORD.
verses.ct: He sent young Israelite men to offer burnt offerings and to sacrifice bulls as peace offerings to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Moses took half of the blood, and put it in basons; and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
verses.web: Moses took half of the blood and put it in basins, and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
verses.ct: Moses collected half of the blood and put it in basins. The other half he sprinkled on the altar.

verses.kjv: And he took the book of the covenant, and read in the audience of the people: and they said, All that the LORD hath said will we do, and be obedient.
verses.web: He took the book of the covenant and read it in the hearing of the people, and they said, “We will do all that LORD has said, and be obedient.”
verses.ct: Then he took the book of the covenant and read it out loud to all the people. They responded, "We will do everything the LORD has said. We will obey."

verses.kjv: And Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, Behold the blood of the covenant, which the LORD hath made with you concerning all these words.
verses.web: Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, “Look, this is the blood of the covenant, which LORD has made with you concerning all these words.”
verses.ct: Moses took the blood from the basins and sprinkled it on the people. He said, "This is the blood of the covenant that the LORD has made with you, based on all these words."

verses.kjv: Then went up Moses, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel:
verses.web: Then Moses, Aaron, Nadab, Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel went up.
verses.ct: Then Moses, Aaron, Nadab, Abihu, and 70 of Israel's elders went up the mountain.

verses.kjv: And they saw the God of Israel: and there was under his feet as it were a paved work of a sapphire stone, and as it were the body of heaven in his clearness.
verses.web: They saw the God of Israel. Under his feet was like a paved work of sapphire stone, like the skies for clearness.
verses.ct: There they saw the God of Israel. Beneath his feet was something like a pavement made of sapphire, as clear and brilliant as the sky itself.

verses.kjv: And upon the nobles of the children of Israel he laid not his hand: also they saw God, and did eat and drink.
verses.web: He didn’t lay his hand on the nobles of the children of Israel. They saw God, and ate and drank.
verses.ct: God did not strike down these leaders of Israel, even though they saw him. They ate and drank in his presence.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Come up to me into the mount, and be there: and I will give thee tables of stone, and a law, and commandments which I have written; that thou mayest teach them.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Come up to me on the mountain, and stay here, and I will give you the stone tablets with the law and the commands that I have written, that you may teach them.”
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "Come up to me on the mountain and stay there. I will give you stone tablets with the law and commands I have written, so you can teach the people."

verses.kjv: And Moses rose up, and his minister Joshua: and Moses went up into the mount of God.
verses.web: Moses rose up with Joshua, his servant, and Moses went up onto God’s Mountain.
verses.ct: Moses got up, along with his assistant Joshua, and Moses went up onto the mountain of God.

verses.kjv: And he said unto the elders, Tarry ye here for us, until we come again unto you: and, behold, Aaron and Hur are with you: if any man have any matters to do, let him come unto them.
verses.web: He said to the elders, “Wait here for us, until we come again to you. Behold, Aaron and Hur are with you. Whoever is involved in a dispute can go to them.”
verses.ct: Before leaving, he told the elders, "Wait here for us until we come back. Aaron and Hur will stay with you. If anyone has a dispute, bring it to them."

verses.kjv: And Moses went up into the mount, and a cloud covered the mount.
verses.web: Moses went up on the mountain, and the cloud covered the mountain.
verses.ct: Moses climbed up the mountain, and a cloud covered it completely.

verses.kjv: And the glory of the LORD abode upon mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days: and the seventh day he called unto Moses out of the midst of the cloud.
verses.web: LORD’s glory settled on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days. The seventh day he called to Moses out of the middle of the cloud.
verses.ct: The glory of the LORD settled on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it for 6 days. On the 7th day, the LORD called out to Moses from inside the cloud.

verses.kjv: And the sight of the glory of the LORD was like devouring fire on the top of the mount in the eyes of the children of Israel.
verses.web: The appearance of LORD’s glory was like devouring fire on the top of the mountain in the eyes of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: To the Israelites watching from below, the glory of the LORD looked like a blazing fire consuming the top of the mountain.

verses.kjv: And Moses went into the midst of the cloud, and gat him up into the mount: and Moses was in the mount forty days and forty nights.
verses.web: Moses entered into the middle of the cloud, and went up on the mountain; and Moses was on the mountain forty days and forty nights.
verses.ct: Moses stepped into the cloud and continued up the mountain. He stayed there for 40 days and 40 nights.
